intro: Phlomoides dshungarica, commonly known as the Siberian blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. It has slender, hairy stems and linear, grass-like leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Phlomoides dshungarica is often found in dry, rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
